REQUEST FOR AN AMENDEMNT AND EXTENSION
The ori4,inal contract Is scheduled to end on August 31> 1964* The NAEB
requests now that the contract be amended to extend this period until
June 30, 1965. A small budget extension to cover personnel costs during
this period is the only additional expense involved, and there is reason
to believe that the benefits to be derived from extending the project are
substantial.
This request for amendment is necessitated by roughly seven months of
negotiations on earlier contract changes and amendments that were requested
by the Advisory Coamnittee, and in principle, felt by the Office of Education
to be worthwhile suggestions. The delays were not the fault of any one
of the parties to the contract, but a result of the lengthy discussion
and negotiation which \mre required to assure that changes were necessary
and that they were being presented and execute! in an effective manner.
The delays have, however, made it necessary to adjust the schedule of the
project and it is for this reason that this request is being submitted.
The Office of Education has already approved, in principle, an extension
of this project to cover at least the period of time during which the
films will be produced. By agreement with the Office of Education, the
University of Texas, and the National Association of Educational BroadÂ¬
casters, the last film to be produced should be finished on April 1, 1965*
This alone would require an amendment to cover the time between August 31^
1964, and April 1, I965. An extension to June 30, I965, however, is
requested to allow for ccmpletion of the kit material for the final film
and a conclusion of the production phases of the project. A short period
originally requested for evaluation of the materials is not being sought
as part of this extension inasmuch as this would require an additional
three to four months to complete.
